Detailed Description

SQLite PLDatabase implementation.

Member Function Documentation

+ (id) databaseWithPath: (NSString *)  dbPath  

Creates and returns an SQLite database with the provided file path.

- (id) initWithPath: (NSString*)  dbPath  

Initialize the SQLite database with the provided file path.

Parameters:
dbPath Path to the sqlite database file.

- (BOOL) open  

Open the database connection. May be called once and only once.

Returns:
YES on success, NO on failure.

- (BOOL) openAndReturnError: (NSError **)  error  

Opens the database connection, and returns any errors. May be called once and only once.

Parameters:
A pointer to an NSError object variable. If an error occurs, this pointer will contain an error object indicating why the database could not be opened. If no error occurs, this parameter will be left unmodified. You may specify nil for this parameter, and no error information will be provided.
Returns:
YES if the database was successfully opened, NO on failure.

- (int64_t) lastInsertRowId  

Returns the row ID of the most recent successful INSERT. If the table has a column of type INTEGER PRIMARY KEY, then the value assigned will be an alias for the row ID.

Parameters:
Return the row ID (integer primary key) of the most recent successful INSERT.
